Posts.Content: Dec 1, 2008 01:39PM LilyEve wrote: Thanks Claudia I am back. Everything went fine. It was very very fast. I think doing all the reading from the boad here and elsewhere left me super prepared. It was all as I expected. The only glitch was apparently they did not use enough anethesia, and I could feel the cutting and sample taking. it was like a burning stabbing prickly sensation, but I thought I was supposed to feel that ---LOL--and the tech told me after OH NO!!!! You should not have felt that just pressure. Anyway it still was not bad --just localized. I had two 9 pound kids natural childbirth so the biopsy was nothing in comparison to that. The WORST thing was OMG!!! my rib cage and cheek bone ached after being so compressed on the hard board. My arm went dead too. I ask the tech if people ever faint and she said yes alot! When they get up from the procedure, they may exprience hypotension--that one day she had three women faint, but it happens in odd waves. The doctor was very sweet. I did remember to ask how many samples and she said 12. They got all the calcifications right away. I guess that is good. I bled alot; they were cleaning up for a while, but they saw everything and put the titanium clip in. I am home with my own ice packs (THANK YOU LADIES!!!!) because the one that they gave me was busted and we could not get it to break open and go cold. rofl Anywaythe Doc said she will call me Wednesday. PRAY HARD... I need good news badly... :) Lily
Posts.Title: Calcifications Birad 4 LilyEve Beesie

Posts.Content: Nov 24, 2008 11:00AM LilyEve wrote: Well just an unhappy update. After driving myself crazy and this weekend. WRA called to say they have to reschedule my biopsy because the probe on their machine appears to be off. So now I will begoing in Next Monday instead of tomorrow. I swear someone just decided to take Thanksgiving holiday early and screwed up the schedule. The girl was hesitant and changed her story about why they had to reschedule. Oh well, 7 extra days then the wait for the results. Color me crazed.
Posts.Title: Calcifications Birad 4 LilyEve Beesie

Posts.Content: LilyEve wrote: Dear Friends, Thank you for this forum. I hope someone can help. I was informed Monday, 11/17 after a second mammo (rescreen) that I have calcifications in one breast.  while I was waiting in the dark dressing room with my robe still on, the tech came in and said the first raidologist thinks it is okay but is not sure so hes having a 2nd radiologist weigh in. Next they put me in a big room and said the Doc was coming in to cover the findings.  I am a two time thyroid cancer survivor 48 on synthyroid and lo dose bp meds. I have had a mamo gram (clean) for 6 years. Now I am crushed. The Doc said to have a biopsy. My endocrinologist/Internal doc agree. I have had him for 12 years. I am scheduled 2 days before thanksgiving, a sterotactic (I live in the DC area and wil be going to Wahsington Radiology on K Street). I am going between crying and walking around in a daze trying not to think about it. I am so scared!!!!!!  Here is what the report says: The patient came for further evaluation of abnormality seen in the right breast. The breast are moderately dense. Calcifications at approximately 6:00 axis, anterior one-third of the right breast demonstrate calcifications of varying sizes and shapes in a somewhat segmental distribution. No suspicious mass, asymmetry or architectural distortion is seen in the right breast. No suspcious  mass, asymmetry or architectural distortion is seen in the left breast either.  Impression: Calcifications in the right breats are indeterminate and sterotactic biopsy is recommended. No suspicious findings in the left breast Final Assessment: 4 Suspicious abnormality. A biopsy should be considered. I guess I wonder how folks read this. Also is it worse because the shapes were different and segmented? Is it just me or does it sound like a gazillion spots spread all over the place? They dont give any sizes or numbers....argh. LilyEve  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Calcifications Birad 4 LilyEve Beesie

Posts.Content: Nov 21, 2008 12:25PM LilyEve wrote: thanks Beesie for answering.  I am going to work hard at staying positive. The thyroid cancer twice over really set me back. In my head I stay worried and thisis compounded by quarterly visits and constant blood  tests for that issue. Gratefully I have a good doc on that side, who is very thorough, kind and smart. My husband's mom is 84 and a twice over breast cancer survivor.
Posts.Title: Calcifications Birad 4 LilyEve Beesie

Posts.Content: Nov 23, 2008 06:17AM LilyEve wrote: thanks emily ..unfortunately my reg doc is going away for thanksgiving so even if the results come friday he wont be there to receive them. so i will have to wait another weekend... i was hoping he would be valiant and say he'd call wra while in nyc for thanksgiving but he did not and i won't beg... lol.. will let you know what happens....
Posts.Title: Calcifications Birad 4 LilyEve Beesie

Posts.Content: Dec 1, 2008 04:46AM LilyEve wrote: Thanks so much Missy. It's at 1pm. I got through Thanksgiivng and work yesterday and then started crying getting ready last night. I hate everything about this. I was never this scared with the thyroid cancer, even though I had a rcurrence and two surgeries and am on replacement for life.  I just feel less confident less sure. So your note is the  best thing that has happened these past hours.  I am glad you told me about the tenderness.I am reading alot accounts like that. At least I know what to expect. I have a major holiday work event on Saturday so I am praying I will feel like my normal peppy self and that the results will be good.  I hope you continue to get good news and heal well. Best Lily

Posts.Content: LilyEve wrote: My own doc (god bless him)  called me at 8:45 this morning to say the report was benign. The doc from WRA called later at 2 pm. I will know more when I get the path report. The rad doc said I have great news. She was so disappointed when I told her my doc had called already. She said come back in 6 monrths just so they can check everything. Thats all I know until i see and read what it says. Still in shock.  Thanks for your prayers and help guys.  I came here first and I learned alot. It calmed me down enough to get through Thanksgiving. The biopsy was okay. The area was close to my nipple so it hurts but I am going to sleep now, not so worried anymore. :) Love and Prayers to ALL Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Benign LilyEve Chelee

Posts.Content: Dec 7, 2008 04:02AM LilyEve wrote: thanx beesie..i got the path note..it looks pretty good , probably increased but hey one month at a time...for  now i am happy to have dodged a bullet.....
